Txt_Talk_Rimuldar_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0120_0.Text:
*: Greetings to thee, wanderer.
Thou art welcome here in Rimuldar.

Txt_Talk_Rimuldar_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0110_0.Text: *: Can the dark lord truly have been slain...? But what else could explain why my heart singeth so? Praise be!
*: Lo...the light! Never have I seen it so bright... 'Tis like unto a dream!

Txt_Talk_Rimuldar_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0220_0.Text: *: You are on a quest to defeat the Lord of the Underworld? Then you are the same as Ortega, friends.
*: Thou art on a quest to defeat the Lord of the Underworld? Then thou art the same as Ortega, friend.
*: You are on a quest to defeat the Lord of the Underworld? Then you are the same as Ortega, friends.
*: Thou art on a quest to defeat the Lord of the Underworld? Then thou art the same as Ortega, friend.
*: Mighty Ortega is a warrior of unmatched skill and strength, and could best a group of monsters singlehanded! Verily, he sallied out alone to vanquish the great fiend.

Txt_Talk_Rimuldar_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0320_0.Text: *: None shall defeat the Lord of the Underworld who doth not first possess the Sphere of Light. None.

Txt_Talk_Rimuldar_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0310_0.Text: *: Thanks unto thee, wanderer! Verily, thou art as courageous as thou art mighty! In every part the true hero!

Txt_Talk_Rimuldar_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0420_0.Text: *: Oh... An item of great value lieth among my belongings in the inn.
*: 'Twas entrusted unto me by the mighty Ortega himself... Thinkest thou it might be mistakenly discarded? Perish the thought...

Txt_Talk_Rimuldar_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0410_0.Text: *: Peace reigneth at last! Praise be unto the highest!
*: Ahh, would that mighty Ortega were here to see this day... He would surely be overjoyed...
*: (sigh) Where art thou, Ortega? Wherefore didst thou forsake us?

Txt_Talk_Rimuldar_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0520_0.Text: *: O, mighty Ortega! Wherefore didst thou attempt the crossing to the great fiend's island unprepared? Did the pitiless seas truly claim thee...?

Txt_Talk_Rimuldar_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0510_0.Text: *: Thou hast done well, friend! Now the land may know peace once more!

Txt_Talk_Rimuldar_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0620_0.Text: *: Hmph! Did not he say the outermost part of the town? And where is he, pray? Where? (mutter mutter)

Txt_Talk_Rimuldar_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0610_0.Text: *: Lo...the light! Never have I seen it so bright... 'Tis like unto a dream!

Txt_Talk_Rimuldar_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0720_0.Text: *: Lo, the sage's stone doth heal all a party's wounds, and is not diminished in so doing.
*: Though the stone weareth not, my patience surely doth. Where can my beloved be? She is late indeed...

Txt_Talk_Rimuldar_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0710_0.Text: *: Thou art a true hero, friend!
*: Is't true? Is the dread Lord of the Underworld no more? ...Oh, happy day! Bless thy heroic soul!

Txt_Talk_Rimuldar_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0920_0.Text: *: From what I 'eard the boss got caught tryin' to nick somefink from a church in Tantegel.
*: I'd love to go 'n' see 'im, but every way I go there's bleedin' monsters. Typical...
*: Hmm, I 'ear there's a nice village to the north called Kol wot 'as a nice 'ot spring or two. Maybe I'll try goin' there...

Txt_Talk_Rimuldar_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0910_0.Text: *: Oi! Yeah, you! Didn't there used to be a load of monsters around 'ere? Ugh, tell me I'm not imaginin' fings again...
*: Well, at least the way to Tantegel's clear now. Don't worry boss, we'll be together again soon enuff!

Txt_Talk_Rimuldar_Out_SUB_0_VOLUME_0810_.Text: {LEADER} calms the monster with a soothing voice and tells it about Monty's monster menagerie...

Txt_Talk_Rimuldar_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_1010_0.Text: *: Sail the seas that surround Zoma's citadel and you might stumble upon a spot that's hidden well...

Txt_Talk_Rimuldar_House1_SUB_0_ACTOR_012.Text: *: The auroral armour dwelleth in the selfsame tower where fair Rubiss doth sleep, or so it is told...

Txt_Talk_Rimuldar_House1_SUB_0_ACTOR_011.Text: *: Yea, I am happy indeed! I am glad! I give praise and thanks unto the Most High!
*: I had thought myself not long for this world, but it seemeth that I shall live a while yet! Huzzah!

Txt_Talk_Rimuldar_House1_SUB_0_ACTOR_022.Text: *: The Sacred Amulet serveth as proof of Rubiss's abiding love for all mankind. Let every soul in Alefgard give thanks unto Her!

Txt_Talk_Rimuldar_House1_SUB_0_ACTOR_021.Text: *: Abide awhile, traveller. I must make for thee a great feast to give thanks for our deliverance.
*: Thanks not only from myself, but from Gracious Rubiss also<--->She is surely greatly pleased by thy victory.

Txt_Talk_Rimuldar_House2_SUB_0_ACTOR_012.Text: *: Oh, would that I might look upon a magic key but once before I quit this vale of tears. I have heard such tales about them...
*: Wanderer<--->may I, perchance, examine the curious key in thy possession? I happen to be presently engaged in the research of magical curios, and it appears to mine eye to be most magical indeed.
*: Ah, so I was correct in my assumptions. Now, pray allow me a closer inspection.
*: Hmm...? Curious... Curious indeed... ...Ahh, but of course! How cunning!
*: Erelong, I hope to fashion another in its image, though this will require a doubling of mine efforts.

Txt_Talk_Rimuldar_House2_SUB_0_ACTOR_011.Text: *: Ah, friend! I have attempted to manufacture magic keys like unto thine own in every respect!
*: ...Alas, the process is proving far more difficult than I foresaw. It may be some time till I am able to faithfully reproduce one.

Txt_Talk_Rimuldar_Shop_SUB_0_ACTOR_0120_.Text: *: For a certainty, I did espy a lonely figure, standing at the most westerly point of this isle.
*: What was he about, and wherefore? And whence hath he now vanished?

Txt_Talk_Rimuldar_Shop_SUB_0_ACTOR_0110_.Text: *: The Lord of the Underworld is truly slain? Verily, thou art mighty indeed!

Txt_Talk_Rimuldar_Shop_SUB_0_ACTOR_0210_.Text: *: ...What say'st thou? Thou gavest the Lord of the Underworld a drubbing? Zounds, thou art mighty indeed!

Txt_Talk_Rimuldar_Church_1F_SUB_0_ACTOR_.Text: *: Hm? What say'st thou? There is a realm beyond the heavens where light yet bathes the land? Fie! Speak not such falsehoods to me, knave! I am not so credulous as thou thinkest!
*: Always did I believe! Ever did I have faith! That this day would come, I never doubted! Thanks unto thee, saviour!

*: Thou art come unto a place of foretelling... Of sight beyond sight.
Hark thee well...
*: When the sacred drop lighteth up the darkness... Then shall the rain's bow bear thee from the westmost point of this land unto the isle of the fiend...
*: Hmm... So it was thee who delivered this world from evil? Then we are in thy debt. Thanks unto thee, child.

Txt_Talk_Rimuldar_Church_2F_SUB_0_ACTOR_.Text: *: O benevolent Goddess! Thy will hath been done by <IfSolo(this,these)>, thy humble servant<IfSolo(,s)>! Let all men give thanks unto Thee!
*: Almighty Goddess! Deliver our land from evil, and lead us not into disaster, we beg of Thee!
*: From the bottom of my heart, I do thank thee. Thou hast brought the dawn at last!
*: The captive thou seest before thee is a bearer of false witness. A shameless and unrepentant fabulist.
*: The Lord of the Underworld is truly slain? Verily, thou art mighty indeed!
*: Beneath the Lord of the Underworld's throne, there lieth a secret stairway, hidden to the eye.
*: Yet it mattereth not whom I tell of this<--->for no man believeth me! Wherefore is mine every word cursed to be thought false?
*: Yet I know in my heart of hearts that I speak the truth! Inspect the throne and thou wilt not regret having done so.
*: If, perchance, thou shouldst wish to form a gang of outlaws now that thy quest is done...pray, count me in!

Txt_Talk_Rimuldar_Inn_SUB_0_ACTOR_0110_0.Text: *: From the bottom of my heart, I do thank thee. Thou hast brought the dawn at last!

Txt_Talk_Rimuldar_Inn_Ortega_Memoirs_1.Text: There's something deep in the chest...

Txt_Talk_Rimuldar_Inn_Ortega_Memoirs_4.Text: {HERO} opens up the book and begins to read...

Txt_Talk_Rimuldar_Inn_Ortega_Memoirs_5.Text: {LEADER} returns the diary to the chest.

Txt_Talk_Rimuldar_Inn_Ortega_Memoirs_7.Text: <6>Even though I haven't a clue where I come from, I still see a place in my dreams that feels oddly familiar.

Txt_Talk_Rimuldar_Inn_Ortega_Memoirs_8.Text: <6>It's nothing like this land either. Everyone's happy and full of life, despite the monster menace looming large as it does here too.<9>

Txt_Talk_Rimuldar_Inn_Ortega_Memoirs_9.Text: <6>My memories have been flooding back ever since I left Tantegel.

Txt_Talk_Rimuldar_Inn_Ortega_Memoirs_10.Text: <6>I recall being a warrior, one of the land's finest. It seems I was on a journey long before I ended up here.

Txt_Talk_Rimuldar_Inn_Ortega_Memoirs_11.Text: <6>My resolve is now unbreakable. I'm convinced I'm on the right path; I simply need to see this quest through to the end.

Txt_Talk_Rimuldar_Inn_Ortega_Memoirs_12.Text: <6>However, it must be done alone. Living in terror of monsters for so long has drained the people here of all their fight.<9>

Txt_Talk_Rimuldar_Inn_Ortega_Memoirs_13.Text: <6>There are still a few people whose faces I just can't seem to remember...

Txt_Talk_Rimuldar_Inn_Ortega_Memoirs_14.Text: <6>An old man, a kind woman and a newborn baby.

Txt_Talk_Rimuldar_Inn_Ortega_Memoirs_15.Text: <6>Perhaps they're my kin, or simply those I once held dear?

Txt_Talk_Rimuldar_Inn_Ortega_Memoirs_16.Text: <6>If they are in fact my family, then how they must resent me for choosing this journey over them...

Txt_Talk_Rimuldar_Inn_Ortega_Memoirs_17.Text: <6>But I don't think I would've done things any differently, even with my current perspective.

Txt_Talk_Rimuldar_Inn_Ortega_Memoirs_18.Text: <6>Regardless, there are more important things for me to be getting on with. The small matter of ending the Lord of the Underworld, for one.<9>

Txt_Talk_Rimuldar_Inn_Ortega_Memoirs_19.Text: It appears to be a collection of musings written by Ortega.
